original: Jacobsson, Torsten Eberhard, kapten, brandchef, länsbrandinspektör, Visby, f. 18/12/92 i Grötlingbo, Gotl. 1., av prosten Oscar J. o. Beda Gum-messon. G. 20 m. Lola Hjelmar. — Stud:ex. i Visby 13, res:off:ex. 15, off:ex. 17, ksp-kurs 18, ridkurs 19, gym’n :kurs 20, kurs i und:rätt:tj. 28, tygoff:kurs 28-29, gaskurs 29, kurs i projektilröjn. 41, brandchefskurs v. Kat. II v. statens brandsk. 43. Fänrik i Gotl. inf :reg. res. 15, v. reg. ’17, und:löjtn. 18, löjtn. 20, v. Gotl. inf :kår 28, kapt. i kåren 30, v. Gotl. inf :reg. 37. Reg:adjut. o. tygoff. 30-35, gas-off. 32-35, signaloff. 35-37, kasernoff. 37-40, sektionschef v. VII. mihbef:-staben 41-42, avsk. m. förtidspens. 42, arvodestj. v. reg. s. chef f. personal-detalj. 42-44. V. brandchef i Visby 42, brandchef där sed. 45, länsbrandinsp. i Gotl. 1. sed. 45. Riksförsäkr :anst. omb. i Visby, sekr. o. chefinstrukt. i Gotl. luftskyddsförb. RSO, SkytteM, RLSF förtj:SM o. förtj :t. i guld.
translated: Jacobsson, Torsten Eberhard, Captain, Chief Fire Officer, County Fire Inspector, Visby, b. 18/12/92 in Grötlingbo, Gotland. Son of the vicar Oscar J. and Beda Gum-messon. Married Lola Hjelmar in 1920. He passed his qualifying exams in Visby in 1913, the reserve officer qualification in 1915, and the officer qualification in 1917. He underwent courses in armed forces discipline (1918), riding (1919), gymnasium (1920), sub-legal service (1928), textile officer (1928-29), gas (1929), projectile research (1941). He completed Brandchefskurs at Kat. II v. statens brandsk. in 1943. He was a 2nd lieutenant in Gotland Infantry Regiment's reserves in 1915, and in Västernorrland Regiment in 1917. He was a Lieutenant in 1920, in Gotland Infantry Corps in 1928, captain in the corps in 1930, and in Gotland Infantry Regiment in 1937. He was regimental adjutant and textile officer from 1930-1935, gas officer from 1932-1935, signal officer from 1935-1937, barracks officer from 1937-1940, commissioner of VII. mihbef:-staff from 1941-1942, retired with early pension in 1942 and served as remuneration's officer at the regiment's headquarters for personal details from 1942-1944. He was the Deputy Chief Fire Officer in Visby in 1942, Chief Fire Officer of Visby thereafter from 1945, and County Fire Inspector in Gotland 1. from 1945. He worked as a national insurance agency official in Visby, secretary and chief instructor in Gotland Air Defense Association and was awarded the medal RSO, SkytteM, RLSF förtj: SM and förtj:t in gold.
